cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a large pan and fry the onions until they are soft and translucent.
2. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for a minute.
3. Add the chicken and fry until browned on all sides.
4. Add the spices and fry for a minute.
5. Add the yogurt and stir well.
6. Cover the pan and simmer for 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

1. Heat oil in a large pan and fry the onions until they are soft and translucent.
2. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for a minute.
3. Add the beef and fry until browned on all sides.
4. Add the spices and fry for a minute.
5. Add the tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
6. Cover the pan and simmer for 1 hour or until the beef is tender.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

1. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. 2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger; cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 3. Add beef and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. 4. Stir in tomato and cook for 5 more minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Rinse the rice until the water runs clear. 2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 3. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 4. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. 5. Add the rice and stir to combine. 6. Cover and simmer until the rice is cooked and the chicken is tender, about 20 minutes. 7. Serve hot.

1. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. 2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger; cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 3. Add fish and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. 4. Stir in tomato and cook for 5 more minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. In a large bowl, mix together beef, onion, garlic, ginger, chili pepper, and salt. 2. Form mixture into patties or kebabs. 3. Grill over high heat until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes. 4. Serve hot with naan bread and raita.
In a pot, fry onions until brown, add garlic and ginger. Add chicken and potatoes and stir. Add water and spices and let it cook until chicken is tender.
Fry onions until brown, add garlic and ginger. Add prawns and stir. Add water and spices and let it cook until prawns are cooked. Add tomatoes and cook until the sauce is thickened.
Fry onions until brown, add mutton and yogurt. Add water and spices and let it cook until mutton is tender. Add almonds and cook for 5 minutes.
Fry onions until brown, add garlic and ginger. Add fish and yogurt. Add water and spices and let it cook until fish is cooked.
Slice the eggplants and mix with turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Fry in hot oil until golden brown.
Boil yellow lentils in water. In another pan, fry onions until brown, add garlic and ginger. Add tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. Add the lentils and spices and cook for a few more minutes.

1. Marinate the Ilish fish in a mixture of mustard paste, turmeric powder, green chili, and salt for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown. 
3. Add more mustard paste, green chili, and water to the pan to make a sauce. 
4. Add the fried fish to the sauce and simmer for a few minutes. 
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the prawns until golden brown. Set them aside. 
2. Fry sliced onion until it becomes translucent. 
3. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry for another minute. 
4. Add coconut milk and bring it to a boil. 
5. Add fried prawns and let it simmer for 5-10 minutes. 
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken pieces until they become brown. Set them aside. 
2. Fry sliced onion until it becomes translucent. 
3. Add ginger and garlic paste and fry for another minute. 
4. Add yogurt and bring it to a boil. 
5. Add fried chicken and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes. 
6. Serve hot with paratha or naan.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry sliced onion until it becomes translucent. 
2. Add mustard paste, turmeric powder, and green chili and fry for a few minutes. 
3. Add prawns and fry for a few minutes. 
4. Add a little water and let it cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes. 
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

1. Cut all the vegetables into thin strips.2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and add panch phoron.3. Add the vegetables and turmeric, and saute for a few minutes.4. Add water and salt, and bring to a boil.5. Cover and simmer until the vegetables are tender.6. Serve hot with rice.

1. Boil potatoes and cut into cubes.2. In a pan, heat mustard oil and add poppy seeds, green chillies, and turmeric.3. Add the boiled potatoes and salt.4. Cook until the poppy seeds are fragrant and the potatoes are coated.5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Cut the eggplant into thin slices.2. In a bowl, mix chickpea flour, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.3. Dip the eggplant slices in the mixture to coat.4. Heat oil in a pan and fry the eggplant slices until crispy.5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Cut all the vegetables into small pieces.2. In a pan, heat mustard oil and add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt.3. Add the vegetables and saute for a few minutes.4. Add water and cover the pan.5. Cook until the vegetables are tender.6. Serve hot with rice.

name: Palong Shak Bhaja
cooking_method: Wash the Palong Shak properly and cut them into small pieces. Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onion, minced garlic and green chili. Fry for a while and add the Palong Shak pieces. Add salt to taste and cook until the shak becomes tender.

name: Lau Ghonto
cooking_method: Peel and chop the lau into small pieces. Heat oil in a pan and add sliced onion, minced garlic and ginger and green chili. Fry until the onion becomes soft. Add the shrimp and cook for a while. Add the chopped lau, salt and water. Cook until the lau becomes tender.

name: Pui Shak Chingri Bhorta
cooking_method: Wash the Pui Shak properly and cut them into small pieces. Heat mustard oil in a pan and add sliced onion, minced garlic and green chili. Fry until the onion becomes soft. Add the shrimp and cook for a while. Add the chopped Pui Shak, salt and cook until the shak becomes tender. Mash everything together.

name: Kochur Loti Chingri Bhorta
cooking_method: Wash the Kochur Loti properly and cut them into small pieces. Heat mustard oil in a pan and add sliced onion, minced garlic and green chili. Fry until the onion becomes soft. Add the shrimp and cook for a while. Add the chopped Kochur Loti, salt and cook until everything becomes tender. Mash everything together.

name: Kumro Patay Chingri Bhapa
cooking_method: Wash the Kumro leaves properly and make a pocket. Put the shrimp inside the pocket. Pour the coconut milk on top and add green chili and salt. Close the pocket and tie it up. Steam for 20-25 minutes.

1. Boil the shrimp with salt and turmeric in a pot of water until cooked through. Drain and let cool.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion, cilantro, and green chilies until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the boiled shrimp to the pan and stir well, mashing it slightly with a fork or spatula.
4. Keep stirring and mashing until the shrimp is broken down into a paste-like consistency.
5. Serve hot with rice or bread.

1. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion and green chilies until the onion is translucent.
2. Add the diced eggplant to the pan and stir well.
3. Cover and cook on low heat until the eggplant is tender and cooked through.
4. Add cumin powder and stir well.
5. Mash the eggplant with a fork or spatula until it reaches the desired consistency.
6. Serve hot with rice or bread.

1. Boil the sliced green bananas with turmeric and salt until cooked through. Drain and let cool.
2. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion and green chilies until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the boiled green bananas to the pan and stir well.
4. Mash the bananas with a fork or spatula until it reaches the desired consistency.
5. Serve hot with rice or bread.

1. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onion and green chilies until the onion is translucent.
2. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and stir well.
3. Cover and cook on low heat until the tomatoes are soft and cooked through.
4. Add cumin powder and stir well.
5. Mash the tomatoes with a fork or spatula until it reaches the desired consistency.
6. Serve hot with rice or bread.
